title: How to Make Mummy Brownies

steps.headline: Preheat the oven according to the boxed brownie instructions.
Grease non-stick cooking spray over a baking pan.
Mix the brownie mix with the required ingredients on the box.
steps.description: Combine them together in a large bowl until well-combined.

steps.headline: Pour the brownie batter into the baking pan.
steps.description: Scrape any excess batter with a rubber spatula.

steps.headline: Bake the brownies according to the time mentioned on the box.
steps.description: To test if the brownies have finished baking, poke a toothpick in the middle of the brownies. If the toothpick comes out dry, the brownies are ready to be removed from the oven.

steps.headline: Allow the brownies to cool for a few minutes until warm.
steps.description: It will usually take about 10-15 minutes for the brownies to reach room temperature. Once cool, slice the brownies into square-sized pieces. For quicker cooling, place the brownies in the freezer for about 5-7 minutes until warm.

steps.headline: Melt the white chocolate melts.
steps.description: You can choose to melt them either in the microwave or on a double boiler. Make sure you stir the chocolate occasionally to prevent it from scorching.

steps.headline: Pour the melted chocolate into a Ziploc bag.
steps.description: Snip off the edge with a pair of scissors to make a small hole for drizzling the chocolate with.

steps.headline: Drizzle the melted chocolate all over the brownies.
steps.description: Squeeze just enough over each brownie, drizzling it as a zig-zag motion to create the mummy effect.

steps.headline: Add two candy eyes onto each brownie.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the brownies on a serving plate and serve with a glass of milk. Enjoy!

text: Preheat the oven according to the boxed brownie instructions.  Grease non-stick cooking spray over a baking pan.  Mix the brownie mix with the required ingredients on the box. Combine them together in a large bowl until well-combined. Pour the brownie batter into the baking pan. Scrape any excess batter with a rubber spatula. Bake the brownies according to the time mentioned on the box. To test if the brownies have finished baking, poke a toothpick in the middle of the brownies. If the toothpick comes out dry, the brownies are ready to be removed from the oven. Allow the brownies to cool for a few minutes until warm. It will usually take about 10-15 minutes for the brownies to reach room temperature. Once cool, slice the brownies into square-sized pieces. For quicker cooling, place the brownies in the freezer for about 5-7 minutes until warm. Melt the white chocolate melts. You can choose to melt them either in the microwave or on a double boiler. Make sure you stir the chocolate occasionally to prevent it from scorching. Pour the melted chocolate into a Ziploc bag. Snip off the edge with a pair of scissors to make a small hole for drizzling the chocolate with. Drizzle the melted chocolate all over the brownies. Squeeze just enough over each brownie, drizzling it as a zig-zag motion to create the mummy effect. Add two candy eyes onto each brownie.  Serve. Place the brownies on a serving plate and serve with a glass of milk. Enjoy!
